data: `minecraft:behavior.stalk_and_pounce_on_target` allows an entity to stalk a specific target. Once within range of the target, the entity will then leap at the target and deal damage based upon its attack attribute.
`minecraft:behavior.stalk_and_pounce_on_target` requires a target in order to work properly. Target can be determined by using one of the following behaviors:
`minecraft:behavior.stalk_and_pounce_on_target` requires an attack attribute in order to work properly.

data.Name: interest_time
data.Description: The amount of time the mob will be interested before pouncing. This happens when the mob is within range of pouncing

data.Name: leap_distance
data.Description: The distance in blocks the mob jumps in the direction of its target

data.Name: leap_height
data.Description: The height in blocks the mob jumps when leaping at its target

data.Name: max_stalk_dist
data.Description: The maximum distance away a target can be before the mob gives up on stalking

data.Name: pounce_max_dist
data.Description: The maximum distance away from the target in blocks to begin pouncing at the target

data.Name: set_persistent
data.Description: Allows the actor to be set to persist upon targeting a player

data.Name: stalk_speed
data.Description: The movement speed in which you stalk your target

data.Name: strike_dist
data.Description: The max distance away from the target when landing from the pounce that will still result in damaging the target

data.Name: stuck_time
data.Description: The amount of time the mob will be stuck if they fail and land on a block they can be stuck on
